laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma aldosterone was 24 ng/dL and suppressed PRA (0.6 ng/mL/h) during treatment with ACE-I.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, plasma aldosterone levels decreased, but 14 months after surgery (May 2010), plasma aldosterone increased and PRA remained suppressed.

laboratory_examinations.findings: An increased expression of CYP11B2 was observed in HAC15 adrenal cells overexpressing KCNJ5Y152C compared to the wild-type channel, showing a 4-fold increase.
The patient had reduced renal function, which progressed to end-stage renal disease (ESRD).
Normal catecholamine levels and normal results from dexamethasone suppression tests were reported.
